means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 柯特 Court的变体

sentence.Network_en: "The matter is closed," was the curt reply.
sentence.Network_cn: 得到的答复简短而无礼：“事情已经结束了。”

sentence.Network_en: Her tone of voice was curt.
sentence.Network_cn: 她说话的语气唐突无礼。

sentence.Network_en: His tone was curt and unfriendly.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说话的语调粗暴无礼。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'short, shortened'): from Latin curtus 'cut short, abridged'

entry.tran: 简短而失礼的;唐突无礼的
entry.def: If you describe someone as curt, you mean that they speak or reply in a brief and rather rude way.

example.ex: Her tone of voice was curt...
example.tran: 她说话的语气唐突无礼。

example.ex: 'The matter is closed,' was the curt reply.
example.tran: 得到的答复简短而无礼：“事情已经结束了。”

means.word_mean: 1. marked by rude or peremptory shortness;

sentences.sentence: "try to cultivate a less brusque manner"
"the salesgirl was very short with him"

means.word_mean: 2. brief and to the point; effectively cut short;

sentences.sentence: "a response so curt as to be almost rude"
"short and terse and easy to understand"

auth_sentence.content: David Cameron's response was curt and dismissive.
auth_sentence.res_content: David Cameron's response was curt and dismissive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: David Cameron's response was curt and dismissive.

auth_sentence.content: Curt, derisive tongue and...knowing, cynical eyes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Curt, derisive tongue and...knowing, cynical eyes.

auth_sentence.content: The young man unceremoniously sent it back with a curt note.
auth_sentence.res_content: The young man unceremoniously sent it back with a curt note.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The young man unceremoniously sent it back with a curt note.

sentences.en: He dismissed them with a curt nod.
sentences.cn: 他只随便点了一下头就把他们打发走了。

sentences.en: He gave me an extremely curt answer.
sentences.cn: 他对我作了极为草率的答复。
